results.message: This async method lacks 'await' operators and will run synchronously. Consider using the 'await' operator to await non-blocking API calls, or 'await Task.Run(...)' to do CPU-bound work on a background thread.
Non-nullable property 'Name' must contain a non-null value when exiting constructor. Consider declaring the property as nullable.
Non-nullable property 'Name' must contain a non-null value when exiting constructor. Consider declaring the property as nullable.

Remove this unread private field '_logger' or refactor the code to use its value.
Make '_userManager' 'readonly'.
Make '_signInManager' 'readonly'.
All 'Login' method overloads should be adjacent.
Make 'userManager' 'readonly'.
Make 'roleManager' 'readonly'.
All 'CreateUser' method overloads should be adjacent.
All 'CreateRole' method overloads should be adjacent.
Update this method so that its implementation is not identical to 'EditItemAsync'.

CS1998.shortDescription: Async method lacks 'await' operators and will run synchronously

CS8602.shortDescription: Dereference of a possibly null reference.

CS8618.shortDescription: Non-nullable field must contain a non-null value when exiting constructor. Consider declaring as nullable.

S2933.shortDescription: Fields that are only assigned in the constructor should be "readonly"
S2933.fullDescription: readonly fields can only be assigned in a class constructor. If a class has a field that’s not marked readonly but is only set in the constructor, it could cause confusion about the field’s intended use. To avoid confusion, such fields should be marked readonly to make their intended use explicit, and to prevent future maintainers from inadvertently changing their use.

S4136.shortDescription: Method overloads should be grouped together
S4136.fullDescription: For clarity, all overloads of the same method should be grouped together. That lets both users and maintainers quickly understand all the current available options.

S4144.shortDescription: Methods should not have identical implementations
S4144.fullDescription: When two methods have the same implementation, either it was a mistake - something else was intended - or the duplication was intentional, but may be confusing to maintainers. In the latter case, one implementation should invoke the other.

S4487.fullDescription: Private fields only used to store values without reading them later is a case of dead store. So changing the value of such field is useless and most probably indicates a serious error in the code.
